title: Chris Hughes is living the dream on stage with beau's band Little Mix
text:
Caption: Chris Hughes steps in for Jade on Little Mix tour (Picture: Getty; Chris Hughes)

Jesy Nelson’s boyfriend Chris Hughes is a born entertainer as he joins Little Mix on stage to fill in for poorly Jade Thirlwall.

The 26-year-old didn’t do much but we still would love to see the Love Island star join the girl band.

Jesy invited her beau on tour with her and hopped on stage alongside her, Perrie Edwards and Leigh-Anne Pinnock to soundcheck for their LM5 tour at the SSE Arena in Belfast on Sunday afternoon.

Chris is clearly living his dreams as he uploaded a video to show the great job he had done.

The reality star captioned it: ‘Sound check ahead of tonight’s show. Stepping in for our Jade. Onto the next.’

Although the 2017 islander helped during rehearsals for their show, we don’t think the girls would have allowed him to be on stage for the performance.

A few hours later the star shared a picture alongside the rest of the squad suspended in the air in the arena.

‘Dreams do come true,’ Chris said.

These are the perks of having a musician girlfriend.

Jade ended up turning up to perform that night but fans probably wouldn’t have minded if Chris stayed.

Chris has been the ultimate supporter of Jesy and we can’t help but be a little jealous.

The singer opened up about her suicide attempt at the hands of online bullies in her BBC One documentary Jesy Nelson: Odd One out.

Her boyfriend said in the film: ‘One day it’ll click and she’ll look at herself and she’ll see that she is beautiful and she is unbelievable.

‘She doesn’t see that when she takes her make-up off so that’s why I tell her every night.’

Jade got real tall (Picture: Chris Hughes)

Chris Hughes has been Jesy’s ride or die (Picture: @jesynelson/Instagram)

Not only is Chris the best boyfriend ever, he is also now fronting a new BBC Three documentary alongside his brother on testicular cancer, aptly titled Me, My Brother and Our Balls.

Last year Chris famously had a testicular examination live on This Morning and was hailed a champ by thousands of fans with a YouTube clip of the 26-year-old’s procedure being viewed more than 35 million times.

While the reality star’s bravery undoubtedly spurred on thousands of men to follow in his footsteps, no one could have predicted what would happen next.

His older brother Ben checked himself for the first time, found a lump and was soon diagnosed with testicular cancer.

Five months after confirming the news, the dating show star announced his sibling is ‘cancer free’, with a sweet snap on Instagram.
